Class Graph

java.lang.Object
Graph
public class Graph extends Object
The main Graph class for Assignment 6

  • Method Details

    • getVertices

      public HashMap<String,Graph.Vertex> getVertices()
      Retrieves the vertices of the graph.
      Returns:
      The HashMap of vertices

    • hasEdge

      public boolean hasEdge(String from, String to, int weight)
      Checks if a node has a specific edge to another node.
      Parameters:
      from - The node at the start of the edge
      to - The node at the end of the edge
      weight - The weight of the edge
      Returns:
      True if the node exists in the graph and its edge has the correct weight and points to the correct name

    • hasEdge

      public boolean hasEdge(String from, String to)
      Checks if a node has a general edge to another node.
      Parameters:
      from - The node at the start of the edge
      to - The node at the end of the edge
      Returns:
      True if the node exists in the graph and points to the correct name

    • addNode

      public boolean addNode(String name)
      Adds a node to the graph.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the node to insert
      Returns:
      false if the node already exists in the graph

    • addEdge

      public boolean addEdge(String from, String to, int weight)
      Adds an undirected edge between two nodes with the given weight.
      Parameters:
      from - The first vertex of the edge
      to - The second vertex of the edge
      weight - The non-negative cost of the edge to add
      Returns:
      false if an edge between two nodes already exists, or the weight is invalid

    • addEdges

      public boolean addEdges(String from, String[] toList, int[] weightList)
      Adds edges from the specified source node from to each node in the toList array, with corresponding weights provided in the weightList array.
      Parameters:
      from - The source node of all the edges
      toList - the list of nodes to adds edges to from the source node
      weightList - the list of weights for the corresponding edges
      Returns:
      false if the lengths fo toList and weightList mismatch, or if any weight is invalid

    • removeNode

      public boolean removeNode(String node)
      Removes a specified node from the graph along with all of its connected edges from the graph.
      Parameters:
      node - The name of the node to remove
      Returns:
      false if the node does not exist in the graph

    • removeEdge

      public boolean removeEdge(String from, String to)
      Removes the undirected edge between the specified nodes.
      Parameters:
      from - The first vertex of the edge
      to - The second vertex of the edge
      Returns:
      false if either node does not exist in the graph

    • printGraph

      public void printGraph()
      Prints the graph in adjacency list format. The nodes and their neighbors are listed in alphabetical order.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the String representation of the graph in adjacency list format
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • createGraph

      public static Graph createGraph(String[][] input)
      Creates a graph from a 2D array of Strings, where each row represents an edge in the format {"source", "destination", "weight"}.
      Parameters:
      input - A 2D String array with entries formatted as {"source", "destination", "weight"}
      Returns:
      A new Graph if entire input is correct, null otherwise

    • shortestDistance

      public int shortestDistance(String from, String to)
      Uses Dijkstra's algorithm to compute the shortest distance between two nodes.
      Parameters:
      from - The name of first node
      to - The name of second node
      Returns:
      The shortest distance, otherwise -1 if either node does not exist or there is no path between them

    • minimumSpanningTree

      public List<String[]> minimumSpanningTree()
      Uses Prim's algorithm to compute the Minimum Spanning Tree of the graph.
      Returns:
      a List<String[]> where each String[] represents an edge in the format {source, destination, weight}. The edges can be returned in any order. If the graph is disconnected, the method returns null.

    • mstToString

      public String mstToString()
      Determines the minimum spanning tree for the graph and returns it as a formatted String for testing
      Returns:
      The minimum spanning tree for the graph, where each line is in the form {source, destination, weight}
